children.label: CareProfessionalRole
children.description: A professional role in treating or providing medical care to the patient

children.label: ContactInformation
children.description: One or more ways to contact an individual or organization

children.label: DeceasedIndicator
children.description: Boolean indicator where true indicates the person is deceased.

children.label: FamilyMember
children.description: A person related to the person of record by blood, adoption, or marriage.

children.label: FamilyRelationship
children.description: The relationship between the person of record and another individual

children.label: MedicalCareProvision
children.description: An actor providing or responsible for a providing type of service to the person of record during a time period.

children.label: MedicalProfessional
children.description: A person who is licensed to practice a healing art.

children.label: MedicalSpecialty
children.description: A branch of medicine practiced by the provider

children.label: NationalProviderIdentifier
children.description: A unique 10-digit number to allow providers to identify themselves in a standard way throughout their industry

children.label: Organization
children.description: A social or legal structure formed by human beings

children.label: OrganizationAffiliation
children.description: Membership, association, or connection to an organization

children.label: OrganizationName
children.description: The name of the organization. Sometimes the name is not unique, so we allow for multiple names for the same organization.

children.label: OrganizationType
children.description: A classification of the organization in terms of its major role in healthcare

children.label: SupportProvision
children.description: An actor providing or responsible for non-medical care during a stated time period.

children.label: SupportRole
children.description: A role in treating or providing medical care to the patient

children.label: UnrelatedThirdParty
children.description: A person, other than a medical professional or family member, who is relevant to the health or social situation of the person of record.

children.label: AssociatedSubstanceRisk
children.description: The entry describing the ongoing substance risk that this adverse substance reaction event is a result of.

children.label: AttributionCertainty

concepts.label: Adverse Event Attribution to Product or Procedure (http://uts.nlm.nih.gov/metathesaurus:C1510821)

children.description: A specific identifiable level (defined qualitatively or quantitatively) of probability of adverse event being caused or associated with the product or procedure administration to a patient.

children.label: Criticality
children.description: A clinical judgment as to the worst case result of a future exposure (including substance administration). When the worst case result is assessed to have a life-threatening or organ system threatening potential, it is considered to be of high criticality.

children.label: NegativeSubstanceRisk
children.description: A statement of no known association of a substance and risk of adverse reaction

children.label: NegativeSubstanceRiskAssertion
children.description: A coded assertion of no known adverse reaction risk that includes the substance or substance class in the code.

value.label: code descending from No known allergy (http://snomed.info/sct:716186003)

children.label: NegativeSubstanceRiskSubstance
children.description: A substance that poses no known risk for an adverse reaction.

children.label: PositiveSubstanceRisk
children.description: A record of a clinical assessment of an allergy or intolerance; a propensity, or a potential risk to an individual, to have an adverse reaction on future exposure to the specified substance, or class of substance.

children.label: PositiveSubstanceRiskAssertion
children.description: A coded assertion of an allergy or intolerance that includes the substance in the code.

value.label: code descending from Propensity to adverse reactions (http://snomed.info/sct:420134006)

children.label: PostiveSubstanceRiskSubstance
children.description: A substance that poses a risk of adverse reaction.

children.label: SubstanceAttribution
children.description: The substance to which this adverse event is attributed to

children.label: SubstanceReaction
children.description: An instance of an adverse reaction attributed to ingestion of or contact with a substance

children.label: SubstanceRisk
children.description: A postive or negative clinical statement pertaining to an individual's allergies and intolerances to substances or classes of substances.

children.label: UsualManifestation
children.description: The expected or usual symptoms that result from the exposure, such as sneezing, rash, etc.

children.label: Address
children.description: An address expressed using postal conventions (as opposed to GPS or other location definition formats). This data type may be used to convey addresses for use in delivering mail as well as for visiting locations and which might not be valid for mail delivery. There are a variety of postal address formats defined around the world. (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: AddressLine
children.description: Part of an address that contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information. (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: City
children.description: The name of a city, town, village or other community or delivery center. (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: Comment
children.description: A critical or explanatory note written to discuss, support, explain changes to, or dispute information.

children.label: Country
children.description: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted, expressed in ISO 3166 Alpha-2 (2-letter) codes

children.label: County
children.description: The name of the administrative area at a level below that of a state but above that of a city or town. Outside the US, a district or the equivalent. (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: Description
children.description: An account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

children.label: Details
children.description: Particulars considered individually and in relation to a whole.

children.label: Duration
children.description: The length of time that something continues

children.label: EffectiveDateRange
children.description: The date and time span for when an entry is active or valid.

children.label: EndTime
children.description: The time at which something is to end or did end.

children.label: EntryType
children.description: Fully-qualified name of the type of entry that is missing

children.label: Explanation
children.description: A set of statements describing a group of facts that clarifies the cause, context and/or consequence of those facts.

children.label: FamilyName
children.description: The portion of a person's name that reflects the genealogy of the person. In western cultures, this is the 'last' name. In eastern cultures, the family name appears before the person's given name(s). In some cultures (e.g. Eritrea) the family name of a son is the first name of his father. (Source: HL7 V3)

children.label: FullName
children.description: A full human name as it is spoken or written

children.label: GeopoliticalLocation
children.description: The countries of the world and major geopolitical subregions, such as US states

children.label: GivenName
children.description: A set of names given to a person at birth, but not including the family name. In western cultures, this property would contain the 'first' and 'middle' names. Note that in some cultures, the given name is placed after the family name. Note also that this property contains multiple elements, so it can handle those situations where a person has more than one 'middle' name. (Source: HL7 V3)

children.label: HumanName
children.description: A name for a human being.

children.label: HumanNamePrefix
children.description: Contains a set of honorific terms that typically appear before a person's name, for example Mr., Mrs., Dr., etc. Prefixes have a strong association to the immediately following name part. (Source: HL7 V3)

children.label: HumanNameSuffix
children.description: Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the end of the name.

children.label: MissingEntryExplanation
children.description: The reason for why an Entry of the given EntryType and matching the Expression does not exist.

children.label: MissingEntryReason
children.description: A coded reason for the non-existence of an entry.

children.label: Onset
children.description: The beginning or first appearance of a mental or physical disorder.

children.label: OnsetAge
children.description: The age when manifestations initially showed

children.label: OnsetDate
children.description: Date when manifestations first showed

children.label: OnsetDateTime
children.description: Date and time when manifestations first showed

children.label: Period
children.description: A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year

children.label: PostalCode
children.description: A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service. (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: Priority
children.description: A numbered priority where 1=highest priority, 2=second highest priority, etc

children.label: SpecificCriteria
children.description: Any additional criteria defining the entry that doesn't exist, such as an attribute value

children.label: StartTime
children.description: The time at which something is to start or did start.

children.label: State
children.description: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (i.e. US 2 letter state codes). (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: Substance
children.description: A material, mixture, class or category of substance, including drugs, foods, environmental agents, etc.

children.label: Summary
children.description: A shortened version of an item of information, containing only the main points.

children.label: Symptom
children.description: An indication that a person has a condition or disease or manifestation of that condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

value.label: code descending from Finding reported by subject or history provider (http://snomed.info/sct:418799008)

ancestor.label: Finding reported by subject or history provider (http://snomed.info/sct:418799008)

children.label: UnitedStatesState
children.description: A state or territory in the USA expressed by 2-letter US Postal code

children.label: AddressOfResidence
children.description: A location where a person lives or has lived

children.label: AdministrativeGender
children.description: Gender is used to refer to administrative sex rather than biological sex and therefore should easily be classified into female and male.  This attribute does not include terms related to clinical gender.

children.label: CountryOfIssue
children.description: A country acting as an assuing authority for a document

children.label: DateOfBirth
children.description: A date of birth or approximate year or period (year or date range), if estimated.

children.label: Direct
children.description: A flag indicating if this is a DIRECT email address

children.label: DriversLicense
children.description: Identifying information from a drivers license

children.label: DriversLicenseNumber
children.description: Driver's license number

children.label: EmailAddress
children.description: An email address xx@yy.zz

children.label: EmailContact
children.description: An email address used to contact an individual

children.label: EmailPriority
children.description: Indicates the preferred order of use of email addresses

children.label: Ethnicity
children.description: A code classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing a common real or presumed heritage. (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: FathersName
children.description: The name of the father as it was or likely to have been recorded on the birth certificate of the patient of record; most likely the name of the father at the time of birth of the person of record.

children.label: IssuingOrganization
children.description: An organization acting as an issuing authority or trust source

children.label: LeaveMessage
children.description: Indicator whether it is ok to leave a voice message. This can be important when messages can be accessed by multiple people, such as on a home phone.

children.label: MaritalStatus
children.description: The most recent marital status of a person.

children.label: MothersMaidenName
children.description: The name of the mother as it was or likely to have been recorded on the birth certificate of the patient of record. This is most likely the name prior to marriage of the mother (aka the maiden name).

children.label: MultipleBirth
children.description: Birth of more than one child at the same time to the same parents.

children.label: MultipleBirthBoolean
children.description: Indication if a birth event was a multiple birth.

children.label: MultipleBirthOrder
children.description: Order of birth in multiple birth event

children.label: OrganizationalIdentifier
children.description: Patient identifier at a healthcare provider, insurer, or other related organization.

children.label: OtherTelecomContact
children.description: A means of contacting an individual electronically, other than by telephone or email

children.label: Passport
children.description: Indicator of citizenship and identity

children.label: PassportNumber
children.description: Passport number

children.label: PersonOfRecordName
children.description: A name for the person of record.

children.label: PlaceOfBirth
children.description: The location of a birth event. There may be multiple entries, but a person has only one place of birth.

children.label: Race
children.description: A code classifying the person into a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, geographical origin or nationality. (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: ResidenceAddressDescription
children.description: The type of residence, for example a private house, a skilled nursing facility, or homeless shelter

children.label: ResidenceAddressUse
children.description: Describes how the residence is used, in particular, as a primary, secondary, or former address

children.label: SocialSecurityNumber
children.description: A US social security number (SSN)

children.label: StateOfIssue
children.description: Issuing authority for a drivers license

children.label: TelecomMethod
children.description: The type or channel of the communication, such as Skype or WhatsApp

children.label: TelecomNumberOrID
children.description: A telephone number, email address, user name or other identifier on a telecommunication network, such as a SkypeID

children.label: TelecomUse
children.description: A purpose for which a particular telecommunication channel should be used.

children.label: TelephoneContact
children.description: Information about a telephone that can be used to contact a person or organization.

children.label: TelephoneNumber
children.description: A telephone number, including a country code and extension, if required

children.label: TelephoneOrganizationName
children.description: Name of organization owning the phone number, if it belongs to an a company, group home, or other organization.

children.label: TelephonePriority
children.description: Describes how the residence is used, in particular, as a primary, secondary, or tertiary contact

children.label: TextCapable
children.description: Whether a telephone accepts text messages

children.label: Heritage
children.description: Subjective association with a tribe, racial group, place of family origin, or other inherited background

children.label: Anonymized
children.description: Flag indicating if this record has been anonymized

children.label: ContentAttribution
children.description: From whom or what the information originates, as distinct from the actor creating the entry

children.label: ContentCreationDate
children.description: The date on which content was created, or content creation began

children.label: ContributingRecord
children.description: A health record used to help populate the current health record

children.label: EntryAction
children.description: A description of the action taken on this entry

children.label: EntryID
children.description: A unique, persistent, permanent identifier for an entry in a health record

children.label: EntryMetadata
children.description: Describes the identification, timing, attribution, and other circumstances involved in an SHR entry

children.label: EventLog
children.description: A record of changes to the entry, similar to a commit log.

children.label: FictionalPerson
children.description: Flag indicating if this record represents a fictional (not real) person

children.label: HealthRecordID
children.description: Identifier for a health record. Interpreted in the context of the providing organization.

children.label: Language
children.description: An identifier for a human language

children.label: LastUpdated
children.description: The time the entry was last updated (changed)

children.label: PersonOfRecordID
children.description: The persistent, unique ID of the person described by and tracked by this record. This ID has no intrinsic meaning and should not contain any identifiable information, such a mashup of name and birth date.

children.label: ProvidingOrganization
children.description: The organization providing information or resource

children.label: RecordedBy
children.description: Indicates the person or authoritative body who brought the item into existence

children.label: ShrInformation
children.description: Basic information about the SHR and the Person of Record

children.label: StandardHealthRecordID
children.description: The persistent, unique ID of this standard health record

children.label: WhenAccessed
children.description: Point in time when data was last accessed

children.label: WhenRecorded
children.description: The point in time when a piece of information was recorded
